body_html:
Solved it as follows: Do not fill in a soft link when ./configure asks where your python is. Answer the real python location.

Thank you. Changing the /usr/bin/python3 to /usr/bin/python3.4m of configure path resolve my problem as I installed python3.4 in the centos7.
body_text:
Solved it as follows: Do not fill in a soft link when ./configure asks where your python is. Answer the real python location.

Thank you. Changing the /usr/bin/python3 to /usr/bin/python3.4m of configure path resolve my problem as I installed python3.4 in the centos7.
body:
> Solved it as follows: Do not fill in a soft link when ./configure asks where your python is. Answer the real python location.

Thank you. Changing the /usr/bin/python3 to /usr/bin/python3.4m of configure path resolve my problem as I installed python3.4 in the centos7.
